ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates two different methods of creating Custom PointMarkers in SciChart:
[b]#1 By inheriting[/b] [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.PointMarkers.BasePointMarker.html']BasePointMarker[/url]
Using this method, you can inherit BasePointMarker and override Draw. The Draw method is called for every single point which is on-screen in your DataSeries. Use the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Drawing~SciChart.Drawing.Common.IRenderContext2D.html']RenderContext API[/url] to do the drawing.
[b]#2 By inheriting[/b] [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.PointMarkers.BitmapSpriteBase.html']BitmapSpriteBase[/url]
Using this method, you can inherit BitmapSpriteBase and override RenderToCache. The RenderToCache method is called once and allows you to cache a single marker using the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Drawing~SciChart.Drawing.Common.IRenderContext2D.html']RenderContext API[/url]. This method is far faster but all markers must look the same.
[i][b]Note:[/b][/i] [i]There is also another method, by using[/i] [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.PointMarkers.SpritePointMarker.html']SpritePointMarker[/url]. [i]This method allows you to cache a WPF UIElement to bitmap and repeatedly draw.[/i]
